item.title: Scanning ISBN Barcodes to Add Books to Your Zotero Library
item.description: There is a fast and easy way to add book sources to your Zotero Library when you are doing research at the library. Just scan the ISBN barcode with your Android device and it will add all of the essential bibliographic data for the book to your online Zotero account! You will need: Android device with a camera (but I’m an iOS user!) Zotero account (a free account includes 300MB of storage) Barcode Scanner app free from Google Play Set up the barcode scanner: Install the Barcode Scanner app Open the app Tap the more dots in the upper right corner Tap Settings Scroll to Custom search URL and tap it Custom search URL

item.title: Welcome to SoCoHist!
item.description: SoCoHist contains posts about using technology to make research and writing easier. Topics include collaborative writing applications, LaTeX, Markdown, and Zotero.

item.title: About SoCoHist
item.description: SoCoHist contains posts about how to use technology to make research and writing fun and easy. Topics include collaborative writing applications, LaTeX, Markdown, and Zotero. Additionally, posts can be found about a smattering of other subjects like the history of New Mexico and Southern Colorado, independent publishing, libraries, and recommended software, products, and services. Tim Blevins is an archivist, librarian, and avocational historian living in Southern Colorado and New Mexico.
